meanings.sent1: The decision was arguable among the group.
meanings.sent2: It is arguable whether the movie was good or bad.
meanings.sent3: The arguable topic of dessert preferences sparked a lively discussion.
meanings.sent4: Her choice of outfit was arguable, drawing mixed opinions from her friends.
meanings.sent5: The arguable nature of the painting left art critics divided.

meanings.definition: Capable of being argued or debated.
meanings.sent1: The new policy is arguable and may need further discussion.
meanings.sent2: His theory is arguable and requires more evidence to support it.
meanings.sent3: The arguable nature of the weather forecast led to confusion among the viewers.
meanings.sent4: The decision to move the event indoors was arguable, given the sunny weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The arguable point in the debate left the audience pondering both sides.
